question: Which state has won the UN Award for Performance in Non-Communicable Diseases related SDGs?
explanation:
Kerala has received the United Nations award for its "outstanding contribution" towards the Non-communicable diseases-related sustainable development goals (SDGs).
World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General announced this yearâ€™s UN Interagency Task Force (UNIATF) award on prevention and control of non-communicable diseases. Kerala is one among the seven ministries of health across the world.
